newsitem.title: USA: UAL's United to unveil new ad campaign.
newsitem.headline: UAL's United to unveil new ad campaign.

text.p: UAL Corp, parent of United Airlines, said it will unveil a new advertising campaign in New York May 22, which will reflect its new customer satisfaction philosophy.

"We believe our new service philosophy will set United apart from its competitors, motivate our employees to new heights of service, and drive above-industry growth and revenues," Gerald Greenwald, chairman, said in a statement.

United said the initiative stems from a study of U.S. domestic and international air travelers, which showed the U.S. airline industry as a whole consistently fails to meet its passengers' expectations and needs.
United said it admits its own customer service often falls short of what is desired by business travelers.

The study took nearly nine months to complete and involved more than 50 focus groups with customers in eight countries, more than a dozen focus groups with United employees and a series of interviews with key travel agencies, corporate accounts and suppliers.
The study was conducted by The Cambridge Group of Chicago and MSB of the United Kingdom.
